info.title: Оригинальные запчасти для спецтехники и грузовых автомобилей | Завод УрДЗ
info.description: OpenAPI 3.0 specification for WordPress REST API. Compatible with wp/v2 endpoints (posts, pages, terms, users, etc.) and custom namespaces. Aligned with [WordPress REST API Handbook](https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/). Authentication: Cookie/Nonce for same-origin, Application Passwords for external apps.

schema.description: Total number of records in collection

X-WP-Total.description: Total number of records in the collection. Per WordPress REST API pagination.

schema.description: Total number of pages

X-WP-TotalPages.description: Total number of pages encompassing all available records. Per WordPress REST API pagination.

get.description: List all pages with pagination. To get a specific page, use the slug parameter (e.g. slug=home).

parameters.name: _fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated fields to include. Supports dot notation. Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/global-parameters/

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Response scope: view, embed, or edit. Determines which fields are returned. Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/global-parameters/

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter results by search string

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by post status: publish, draft, pending, private, etc.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order: asc or desc

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Field to sort by: date, title, id, slug, etc. Per WP REST API.

parameters.name: _embed
parameters.description: Include linked resources (e.g. author, wp:term). Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/global-parameters/

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page number. Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/pagination/

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Maximum number of items per page (max 100). Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/pagination/

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of items to skip in result set

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Limit result to item(s) with specific slug(s). Use for single item by slug.

parameters.name: acf_format
parameters.description: ACF fields format when Advanced Custom Fields plugin is active (e.g. standard)

content.description: The content of the post/page. HTML supported.

status.description: Post status: publish, draft, pending, private. Per WP REST API.

get.description: Get specific Page by ID with ACF fields

parameters.name: acf_format
parameters.description: ACF fields format when Advanced Custom Fields plugin is active (e.g. standard)

parameters.name: force

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: ID of the Page

WP_Post.description: WordPress Post object. Schema aligns with [Posts Reference](https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/reference/posts/).

guid.description: Globally unique identifier for the post

yoast_head_json.description: Yoast SEO metadata when plugin is active

WP_Page.description: WordPress Page object. Schema aligns with [Pages Reference](https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/reference/pages/).

WP_Term.description: WordPress Term object (category, tag, etc.). See [Categories](https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/reference/categories/), [Tags](https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/reference/tags/).

WP_REST_Error.description: WordPress REST API error response. Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/extending-the-rest-api/controller-classes/

example.message: You are not currently logged in.

cookieAuth.name: wordpress_logged_in
cookieAuth.description: Cookie auth for logged-in users. For same-origin AJAX, prefer X-WP-Nonce header. Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/authentication/

nonceAuth.name: X-WP-Nonce
nonceAuth.description: Nonce for CSRF protection. Use wp_create_nonce('wp_rest'). Required for same-origin authenticated requests. Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/authentication/

applicationPassword.description: Application Passwords (WordPress 5.6+). Create in Users > Profile > Application Passwords. Use with Basic auth over HTTPS. Per https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/authentication/
